race.name: Medusa
entries: As a Medusa, you gain the following traits:

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one ability score and increase it by 2. Choose another ability score and increase it by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Medusas do not seem to age once they have reached maturity, and their maximum lifespan is unknown.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Monstrosity.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Blindsight
entries: Due to your cursed gaze, you have learned to navigate without sight to avoid accidentally petrifying others. You have {@sense blindsight} with a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind {@quickref Cover||3||total cover}, even if you're {@condition blinded|srd} or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an {@condition invisible|srd} creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} within 60 feet of you as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} and in darkness as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: As an action, you can fix your gaze on one creature within 30 feet of you that you can see and that can see your eyes. The target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). A creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained|srd}. The {@condition restrained|srd} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition petrified|srd} on a failure or ending the effect on a success. A creature {@condition petrified|srd} by this effect can repeat the Constitution saving throw every minute, with disadvantage, until it succeeds and ends the effect. Otherwise, the petrification lasts until the creature is freed by a *greater restoration* spell or similar magic.

If the target creature's challenge rating (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating) is greater than or equal to your character level + 3, the target has advantage on its saving throws against this effect.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Snake Hair
entries: In place of normal hair, your head is adorned with a nest of snakes, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

feat.name: Venomous Bloodline
entries: You have developed venom glands, just like your powerful ancestors. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain resistance to poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|srd}.
Whenever you hit with an attack with your Snake Hair trait, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d6} poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: College of Comedy
entries: Spoilers lol.

subclassFeature.name: Butt of the Joke
entries: You have learned to make a creature's failure or misfortune even more embarrassing. As a reaction when a creature misses an attack, or fails an ability check or saving throw, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to deal {@damage 2d6} psychic damage.
The psychic damage increases when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to {@damage 3d6} at 5th level, {@damage 5d6} at 10th level, and {@damage 8d6} at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Laughter is the Best Medicine
entries: You can harness your jovial wit to help creatures recover from their injuries. As a bonus action, you can expend one use of Bardic Inspiration and choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Roll the Bardic Inspiration die twice. The creature regains hit points equal to the total number rolled on the dice plus your Charisma modifier (minimum of 3 hit points).

subclassFeature.name: Master of Mirth
entries: You have mastered the art of comedy to such an extent that your mere presence can uplift allies and demoralize foes. As an action, you can perform a comedic routine that lasts for 1 minute. During this time, you and all friendly creatures within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}, and they gain temporary hit points equal to your Bard level at the start of each of their turns.
You can use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Stand-Up Routine
entries: You have become a legendary figure in the world of comedy, known for your ability to turn any situation into a humorous spectacle. As an action, you can perform a stand-up routine that lasts for 1 minute. During this time, you can choose one creature within 60 feet of you that can hear you. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn as it is overwhelmed by laughter.
You can use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Strife Domain
entries: Clerics of the Strife Domain view conflict not merely as a means to an end, but as a crucible in which greatness is forged. They sow discord and malcontent to incite conflict in the names of their deities, examples of which appear in the Strife Deities table.

Strife clerics are often war-priests, tacticians, insurgents, or ideologues who revel in all kinds of conflict: social, internal, and external. They are not mere warmongers; they are orchestrators of upheaval, pushing societies, leaders, and individuals to face their trials and emerge stronger–or fall.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Strife Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Agent of Discord
entries: You learn to sow unrest even among allies and exploit the tensions between them. As an action, you can force a creature within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw against your cleric spell save DC. On a failure, it becomes agitated until the start of your next turn.

While agitated, the creature has disadvantage on concentration saving throws and cannot benefit from or take the {@action Help} action. If it attempts to cast a spell that targets more than one creature, it must roll a {@dice 1d6|d6|Agent of Discord}. On a 1, it targets a random ally instead of one of its intended targets.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Instigate Conflict
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to incite chaos and turn allies into enemies. As an action, choose a point you can see within 30 feet. Each creature of your choice within a 10-foot radius of that point must make a Wisdom saving throw against your cleric spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is compelled to fight.

For 1 minute, each affected creature regards all creatures (except themselves and you) as hostile. They use their reactions to make opportunity attacks, even against their allies, and must attempt to damage a creature on their turn, though they can choose the method (non-lethal, ranged, etc.). The affected creatures can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

subclassFeature.name: Strife-Born Resilience
entries: Your divine connection to conflict grants you resilience when things go wrong. When you fail a saving throw or miss with an attack roll, you can choose to reroll the check. If you do, a creature of your choice within 30 feet of you takes psychic damage equal to your cleric level as your frustration lashes out.
You can use this feature once per turn, up to a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} psychic damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to {@damage 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Fracture Alliances
entries: You fully embody the divine force of conflict. When a hostile creature within 30 feet of you uses an ability to grant its ally a beneficial effect, such as Bardic Inspiration, the {@spell guidance} or {@spell resistance} spells, or an effect that restores hit points, the creature granting the benefit must make a Charisma saving throw against your cleric spell save DC. On a failure, the effect works as normal, but the target of the effect takes psychic damage equal to 2d8 + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).
You can use this feature only if you aren't {@condition incapacitated|srd}. Once you use it, you can't do so again until the start of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Terror Domain

entries: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain.

Fear is a survival mechanism. Terror Clerics harness that raw, primal feeling to debilitate their foes and cause unrest in the names of their gods, examples of which are listed in the Terror Deities table.
Though usually associated with evil gods, Terror Clerics are not always evil. Some prefer to use their powers for more benign purposes, such as pranks. After all, life's no fun without a good scare.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Terror Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrip
entries: You gain the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip if you don't already know it. This cantrip counts as a cleric spell for you but doesn't count against the number of cleric cantrips you know.
When you cast {@spell minor illusion}, you can create both a sound and an image with a single casting of the spell, and it doesn't require verbal components.

subclassFeature.name: Dreadful Presence
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill, and you gain a bonus to {@skill Intimidation} checks equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).
You also gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Peep the Horrors
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to invoke fear in the hearts of your enemies. As an action, you present your holy symbol, forcing each hostile creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes psychic damage equal to 2d8 + your cleric level and is {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.
A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Scared Stiff
entries: Your experience with utter dread has given you nerves of steel. You are immune to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

Additionally, if a creature within 60 feet of you is {@condition frightened} of you, you can use your bonus action to force it to freeze in terror. The creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Living Nightmare
entries: Your dreadful powers grant you sway over even the most steadfast creatures. If a creature is normally immune to being {@condition frightened}, your spells and abilities that {@condition frightened||frighten} creatures can still cause that creature to be {@condition frightened}. It has advantage on its saving throws against such effects.

If a creature normally has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}, it can't benefit from advantage against your spells and abilities that {@condition frightened||frighten} creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Sanctified Stalker
entries: You have sworn to protect a holy or druidic order, and you have earned a modicum of divine power similar to a cleric or paladin. You hunt down those that threaten your order, wielding the magic of nature and guided by a higher purpose.

subclassFeature.name: Sanctified Stalker Magic
entries: You learn the Sacred Flame cantrip if you don't already know it.

You also learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Sanctified Stalker Spells table. Each spell counts as a Ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of Ranger spells you know.

entries.caption: Sanctified Stalker Spells
rows: {@spell protection from evil and good}, {@spell sacred flame}

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strikes
entries: Your weapons are infused with holy power, allowing you to sear your foes with divine wrath. When you hit a creature with a weapon, the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage.
The extra damage increases to {@damage 1d10} when you reach 11th level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Hallowed Lore
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Religion} skill, and you gain a bonus to {@skill Religion} checks equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1). In addition, you can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for your Ranger spells.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Retribution
entries: Your devotion shields you, rebuking those who would harm you and your wards. You cannot be {@condition frightened|srd}, and allied creatures within 30 feet of you gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened|srd}.

In addition, whenever you or an ally within 30 feet of you is hit by an attacker you can see, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage your ally takes by an amount equal to your Wisdom modifier + your proficiency bonus (minimum reduction of 2). The attacker then takes that same amount of radiant damage if it is within 30 feet of you. This feature cannot reduce damage below 0 hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Vigilant Sentry
entries: Your divine connection grants you and your allies heightened awareness and clarity. You and allied creatures within 30 feet of you cannot be {@condition frightened|srd} or {@condition surprised|srd}, and gain blindsight to a range of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Heavenly Charge
entries: Your unwavering faith has earned you the command of a rank of heavenly cavalry. As an action, you summon angels in a 60-foot-long, 15-foot-wide line originating from you. Each hostile creature within the space must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 3d8 bludgeoning damage and 3d8 radiant damage as divine warriors stampede through the area. On a successful save, it takes half the damage.

Allied creatures within the area regain hit points equal to 2d8 + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 3), and if they are {@condition blinded|srd}, {@condition deafened|srd}, {@condition paralyzed|srd}, or {@condition poisoned|srd}, they are cured of those conditions (as in the {@spell lesser restoration} spell).
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 4th level or higher to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Serpentine Legacy

entries: Snakes. Why did it have to be snakes?

Your bloodline has been touched by a mighty serpent creature. Perhaps you were born in a cave left behind by a {@creature purple worm}. Or perhaps you trace your lineage back to a {@creature medusa}. Or perhaps you were imbued with this power in a profane ritual to a long-dead snake god. Regardless of your origin, your magic gives you mastery of venom and lets you exert your will over others.
Your serpentine heritage manifests in unique and bizarre ways. At your option, you can pick from or roll on the Serpentine Quirks table to create a quirk for your character.

entries.caption: Serpentine Quirks
rows: Your eyes are covered by transparent scales, and you never blink.
You unconsciously draw out the S sound when you speak.
Your tongue darts out occasionally, as if tasting the air.
Your skin is covered in a thin layer of scales.
You like to sell fake ointments and miracle cures.
When you cast one of your {@subclassFeature Snake Spells|Sorcerer||Serpentine|Talons|1}, the target hears hissing or rattling.

subclassFeature.name: Snake Spells
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Snake Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Snake Spells
rows: {@spell entangle}, {@spell poison spray}, {@spell ray of sickness}

subclassFeature.name: Forked Tongue
entries: You speak in a voice that slithers into the minds of others, making them susceptible to your control. You gain proficiency in either {@skill Deception} or {@skill Persuasion}. Additionally, you gain the ability to verbally communicate with snakes and other serpentine creatures, even if you don't share a common language.
When you reach 14th level in this class, you gain expertise in the skill you chose for this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Venomous Magic
entries: Your very essence is infused with serpentine magic, making you resistant to toxins and letting you lash out with deadly venom. You gain resistance to poison damage, and you gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.
In addition, when you cast a spell that deals damage, you can convert the damage type to poison. If you do so, you add your Charisma modifier to the damage (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Controlled Dose
entries: You have gained a greater measure of control over your poison. When you roll for poison damage, roll the damage twice and choose which roll to use.

subclassFeature.name: Hypnotize
entries: Your connection to serpents has deepened, granting you the power to mesmerize others with your gaze. As an action, you can fix your gaze on one creature within 30 feet of you that you can see and that can see your eyes. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your sorcerer spell save DC. On a failed save, the target is {@condition charmed} by you for one minute. While {@condition charmed}, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0. The effect ends if you or one of your allies damages the creature.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Venom
entries: Your venomous powers have reached new heights. You gain immunity to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.
In addition, poison damage you deal ignores resistance to poison damage and treats immunity to poison damage as resistance.
Finally, when you would roll poison damage, you deal maximum damage instead of rolling.

subclassFeature.name: Ophidian Form
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of serpentine power, allowing you to shed your skin and take on your true serpentine form. As an action, you can magically transform, gaining the following traits:

items: If you are smaller than Huge, you become Huge, and anything you are wearing or carrying melds into your new form. If you are wearing an item, such as an arcane focus, you still benefit from its effects. If there isn't enough room for you to increase your size, your size doesn't change.

Your body shifts into the characteristic long, legless form of a serpent. Your lack of limbs prevents you from casting spells that require somatic components, except for those that deal poison damage or are granted to you by your {@subclassFeature Snake Spells|Sorcerer||Serpentine|Talons|1} feature.
You gain {@sense blindsight} to a range of 30 feet. If you already have {@sense blindsight}, its range increases by 30 feet.

As a bonus action after you cast a spell or a cantrip, you can attempt to wrap your body around a creature within 10 feet of you. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target is {@condition grappled} (your spell save DC to escape). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and you can't constrict another target. You can use your bonus action on subsequent turns to crush the creature, dealing {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage to it.

entries: You can stay in this form for 10 minutes, after which you revert to your normal form. You can dismiss this transformation at any time (no action required). You automatically revert if you drop to 0 hit points or die.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you spend 7 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Winterheart

entries: The cold never bothered me anyway.

Your soul is bound to the unyielding cold of frost and snow. Whether you were born beneath an unnatural blizzard, touched by an ancient winter spirit, or marked by the power of a forgotten frost god, ice runs through your veins. Your magic manifests as biting cold and relentless storms, making you a vessel of winter's beauty and its deadly chill.
Your connection to winter alters the world around you in subtle, mysterious ways. At your option, you can pick from or roll on the Winterheart Quirks table to create a quirk for your character.

entries.caption: Winterheart Quirks
rows: Your breath is always visible, no matter the temperature.
Snowflakes form in your hair during moments of strong emotion.
The air around you is always several degrees colder than the surroundings.
Tears you shed instantly freeze into crystals on your cheeks.
Your heartbeat sounds like faint ice cracking, if someone listens closely.
You can never feel warmth, no matter how hot the environment.

subclassFeature.name: Winter Spells
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Winter Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a Sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of Sorcerer spells you know.
In addition, if a spell deals cold damage but is not otherwise on the Sorcerer spell list, it is on the Sorcerer spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Icicle Barrage
entries: You can fling shards of ice at your foes. You can use your action to make a ranged spell attack at a target within 60 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage and {@damage 1d6} cold damage.
The piercing and cold damage both increase to {@damage 1d8} at 14th level, and the range increases to 120 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Frostblood
entries: The ice in your heart grants you resilience against the cold. You gain resistance to cold damage. In addition, you and everything you wear and carry are unharmed by temperatures of 0 degrees Fahrenheit or lower.

subclassFeature.name: Icicle Volley
entries: When you use your action to attack with your Icicle Barrage feature, you can attack twice with it, instead of once.

subclassFeature.name: Snow Waltz
entries: You can move through {@quickref difficult terrain||3} created by ice or snow without expending extra movement. In addition, you can move across water surfaces as if they were solid ground, but you must end your turn on a solid surface or fall into the water.

subclassFeature.name: Arctic Majesty
entries: Your mastery over ice makes you almost untouchable. You gain immunity to cold damage.

Additionally, you constantly radiate a bitter cold aura. Any creature within 10 feet of you has its speed halved, and when a creature enters the aura on a turn or starts its turn there, it takes cold damage equal to your sorcerer level + your Charisma modifier. You can designate creatures to be immune to this aura (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Winter
entries: Your power transforms the battlefield into an icy tundra. As an action, you can expand the aura created by your Arctic Majesty feature to a 60-foot radius around you, and the aura gains the following additional effects:

items: Bright light in the area is diminished to dim light, and dim light in the area is diminished to darkness.
A hostile creature takes an additional {@damage 4d8} cold damage when it enters the area on a turn or starts its turn there.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you spend 5 sorcery points to use it again.

spell.name: Adrien's Incessant Cravings
entries: You attempt to subtly influence a creature of your choice within range, causing it to desire a certain food. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, its base instincts begin to take over, causing it to crave a specific food of your choice. For the duration, the creature will eat only that food, forsaking all other sources of nutrition.
You must specify a food that the target is capable of eating. For example, you cannot force a {@creature cat|srd} to crave sulphur, nor can you force a {@creature vampire|srd} to crave holy water.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or 3rd level, the effect lasts for 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, it lasts for 24 hours. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, it lasts for a week.

spell.name: Aether Lash
entries: You channel raw arcane energy through the air, striking a foe with chaotic, multicolored strands of pure magic. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} force damage, and on your next turn, you can teleport up to 10 feet as a bonus action.
The spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d8} at 5th ({@damage 2d8}), 11th ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Breaching Smite
entries: The next time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, the attack deals an extra {@damage 3d8} damage of the weapon's type, and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it has a penalty to its AC equal to your spellcasting ability modifier until the spell ends (minimum reduction of 1).

spell.name: Call of the Wild
entries: You call upon the echoes of a beast you have encountered in the past. Choose a {@filter beast of challenge rating of 3 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&3]|type=beast} that you have seen before. You temporarily gain one of its senses, movement speeds, or traits (e.g., darkvision, tremorsense, climbing speed, or keen senses). In addition, you can verbally communicate with beasts, as in the {@spell speak with animals} spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level, the duration increases to 1 hour. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level, the duration increases to 8 hours.

spell.name: Cataclysmic Deluge
entries: You summon a colossal storm cloud that bursts over the battlefield, causing a devastating downpour of water that wreaks havoc on anything caught in its wake. Each creature in a 60-foot-radius, 300-foot high cylinder centered on a point on the ground within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 20d12} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone|srd}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone|srd}.

The water then spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames, including magical ones, in its area and within 60 feet of it. A creature that failed its saving throw is swept 60 feet away by the spreading water. The water disappears at the end of your turn.

A creature that takes damage from running water, such as a {@creature vampire|srd} or a {@creature fire elemental|srd}, takes the maximum damage from the spell, even if it succeeds on the saving throw.

spell.name: Confession Booth
entries: You attune your hearing to divine channels. Choose a creature you can see within range. For the duration, you hear the creature's surface thoughts as whispers carried by angelic voices. You gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks against the creature and automatically know if it speaks a lie, but you gain no additional ability to discern the truth.
If the creature is under the effect of a charm or enchantment, you immediately detect it.

spell.name: Crown of Guilt
entries: You create a crown of shadow on the head of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it suffers debilitating self-doubt as you force it to relive its worst failures. It has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and it can't benefit from advantage on those rolls.

At the start of each of its turns, the creature takes psychic damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.
While a creature is affected by this spell, it sees you as a manifestation of its greatest regret.

components.m: a handful of purple hyacinth petals

spell.name: Crystal Burst
entries: You summon a crystal at a point you can see within range. The crystal explodes, causing an eruption of shards that tear through nearby creatures. Each creature within in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} piercing damage and has its speed halved until the end of your next turn as the shards tear through its body. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and suffers no additional effects.
The shards remain in the area, turning the ground into {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for 1 minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage dd6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Crystal Ward
entries: You touch a willing creature and encase it in a shimmering suit of armor made of translucent black crystal. It gains the following benefits:

items: It has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
It has advantage on Constitution saving throws.
The first time it would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, it instead drops to 1 hit point. If this happens, the material component shatters and is consumed, and the spell ends.

m.text: a piece of black tourmaline worth at least 250 gp

spell.name: Crystalmorph
entries: You transform a willing creature you touch into a being of living crystal. It gains the following benefits:

items: It is immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
It has resistance to fire, force, radiant, and necrotic damage.
Its melee attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d8} radiant damage.

entries: When the spell ends, the creature's crystal body shatters, sending shards of crystal flying through the air. Each creature within 30 feet of the creature when this happens must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 8d8} slashing damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

m.text: a flawless ruby worth at least 1,000 gp

spell.name: Freezing Smite
entries: The next time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon is enveloped in pure, bitter cold, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 3d6} cold damage. The bitter cold assails the target's body, and if the creature is not immune to cold damage, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, its speed is halved until the spell ends.

spell.name: Grasp of Oblivion
entries: You summon writhing black tendrils from a void outside of reality that grasp at a creature within range. The creature takes {@damage 10d12} force damage and is dragged beyond space and time, remaining there for the duration or until it escapes.

The target can use its action to attempt to escape. To do so, it must make a Charisma check against your spell save DC. If it fails, it takes an additional {@damage 5d12} force damage and is {@condition stunned|srd} until the start of its next turn. If it succeeds, it escapes, reappearing in the space it left or, if that space is occupied, in the nearest unoccupied space. When it returns, it gains 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion|srd} and suffers disadvantage on all saving throws for 1 minute due to temporal trauma. Only by finishing a long rest can it remove a level of {@condition exhaustion|srd} gained in this way.
A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this spell dies without making any death saving throws, and it is erased from reality and cannot be resurrected by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

spell.name: Heartfire Surge
entries: You release a burst of raw, burning emotion at a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage and {@damage 3d8} psychic damage and is overwhelmed by the intense emotions, suffering disadvantage on Wisdom ability checks and Wisdom saving throws until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the fire or the psychic damage (your choice) increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Jack-o'-Burst Mine

components.m: a jack-o'-lantern with a lit candle inside, which is destroyed by the activation of the spell

entries: You set a magical trap by infusing explosive magic into a jack-o'-lantern. You can set this item to detonate when someone comes within 5 feet of it, or by a verbal command using your reaction (one or more mines can be detonated). While this spell affects a jack-o'-lantern, the object sheds dim light in a 20-foot cone.

When the jack-o'-lantern explodes, each creature in a 20-foot radius must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} fire damage, and it is outlined in warm yellow light. For the next minute, any attack roll against it has advantage if the attacker can see it, and it can't benefit from being {@condition invisible} (as in the {@spell faerie fire} spell). An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature succeeds on the initial save, it takes half as much damage and suffers no other effects. If a creature is in the area of effect of more than one {@italic jack-o'-burst mine} during a turn, it takes half damage from any mines beyond the first.
A magical mine must be set 5 feet or more from another mine, and cannot be moved once placed; any attempt to move it results in it detonating unless the original caster disarms it as an action.

spell.name: Marrow Spark
entries: You ignite a flicker of necrotic energy in a creature's bones, causing its joints to lock up for a moment. One creature you can see within range must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Marrowgrasp
entries: You magically reach out and grasp at the bones of nearby creatures. Creatures within a 60-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage and is dragged 15 feet closer to the center of the sphere as you wrench its skeleton towards that point. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't moved.
If a creature collides with an object or another creature as a result of being dragged, the creature and whatever it collides with take {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage.
A creature killed by this spell has its skeleton ripped from its body, and it cannot be restored to life by any spell of 6th level or lower.

spell.name: Mournlight Requiem
entries: You draw upon the sorrow of lost souls lingering in destruction. Choose up to 5 creatures you can see within range. They cannot regain hit points by any means, and they gain no benefit from being {@condition invisible|srd}, as a pale blue light clings to them.
At the end of each of an affected creature's turns, it makes a Charisma saving throw. It takes {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, and the spell ends on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Radiant Obelisk

m.text: a crystal rod worth at least 500 gp

entries: A massive, 50-foot-tall crystalline spire erupts from the ground in an unoccupied space you can see within range, bathing the battlefield in shimmering rainbow light. The spire sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet. An allied creature (including you) within the spire's light gains a +3 bonus to AC, and it can change all damage it deals to radiant damage.

An enemy creature within the light must make a Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 4d10} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded|srd} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks that require sight. If the creature is immune to being {@condition blinded|srd} or has blindsight, it does not suffer this disadvantage. You can use a bonus action while the spire is standing to force a creature within the light to immediately make this saving throw again with disadvantage.

spell.name: Rend the Sinew
entries: You trace a cruel sigil of harming in the air with your fingers, commanding an invisible force to tear at a creature's muscle and ligaments. One creature of your choice within range must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d6} slashing damage and suffers the following effects:

items: Its movement speed is halved.
It cannot take the {@action Dash} action.
It has disadvantage on Strength (Athletics) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks.

entries: At the end of each of its turns, the creature repeats the saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d6} slashing damage on a failed save, and the spell ends on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot level above 4th, and the secondary damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 4th.

spell.name: Rimeheart Curse
entries: You curse a creature you can see within range, freezing the blood in its heart. The target takes {@damage 7d8} cold damage and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition restrained|srd} until the end of its next turn as its blood begins to freeze and damage its muscles.

At the end of each of its turns, the creature repeats the saving throw. On a failed save, it takes an additional {@damage 2d8} cold damage and remains {@condition restrained|srd}. On a successful save, the spell ends.
While cursed, the target's breath is visible, and it is vulnerable to fire damage.

components.m: a drop of blood frozen in moonlight

spell.name: Shardstep
entries: You teleport yourself to an unoccupied space you can see within range. Immediately after you disappear, a burst of shattered crystal shards erupts in the space you left, and each creature within 10 feet of the space must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When you reappear, the air shimmers faintly with refracted light.

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also teleport one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell, and there must be an unoccupied space within 5 feet of your destination space for the creature to appear in; otherwise, the creature is left behind.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d10|3-9|1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shardstorm
entries: You conjure a whirling storm of razor-sharp crystal shards in a 20-foot radius, 40-foot high cylinder centered on a point you can see within range. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 6d8} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The shards make the area within the storm {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

spell.name: Shatter Shield
entries: You fashion a protective ward of magic around yourself. For the duration, your AC can't be less than 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your spellcasting ability modifier. The spell ends early if you don armor or if a mage armor spell is cast on you, but it does not end if you don a shield.

As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can cause the ward to shift around you to absorb some of the damage. You take half of the damage from the triggering attack, and the ward shatters, directing the residual magic against the attacker. The attacker must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d4} force damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.

components.m: iron filings and a shard of a broken mirror

spell.name: Slipspace Echo
entries: You phase partially out of sync with your current plane of existence. For the duration, you leave behind a hazy echo image of yourself, and you don't trigger pressure plates, tripwires, or other weight-sensitive traps. You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and non-magical locks and barriers appear faintly transparent to your vision.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

spell.name: Starfire Beam
entries: You conjure a concentrated beam of stellar plasma that tears through the air with an ear-piercing shriek. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} fire damage and {@damage 4d8} radiant damage. If the target is a shadow creature or a creature that suffers penalties while in sunlight, such as a {@creature shadow demon|mm} or a {@creature vampire}, you have advantage on the attack roll, and the creature takes the maximum damage from the spell.
On a miss, the beam continues in a straight line until it hits another creature or object. Repeat the attack roll against the next creature.

components.m: a vial of stardust, a piece of a meteorite, or a magnifying glass

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the fire or the radiant damage (your choice) increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Summon Serpentine Spirit
entries: You call forth the spirit of a mighty snake. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Serpentine Spirit|Talons} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose Constrictor or Venomous. The creature resembles a snake of that kind, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

m.text: a talisman formed into the shape of a snake scale worth at least 400 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Symphonic Displacement
entries: You infuse your body with haunting resonance. Until the spell ends, your voice echoes unnaturally, delaying, harmonizing, or reversing itself, and your movements flicker a heartbeat out of sync. You gain advantage on Charisma checks, and attempts to remember your voice or features after the spell ends are made with disadvantage.

spell.name: Talon's Acid Bath
entries: You magically transform the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 5-foot high cylinder into a pit of bubbling acid. Creatures on the ground in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall into the acid. Creatures with a flying speed have advantage on this save. If a creature succeeds on the saving throw, they safely land on the space closest to their original position that is not in the acid, or an adjacent space outside the acid if the closest one is already occupied.
When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature takes {@damage 2d12} acid damage.

As a bonus action while this spell is active, you can launch a large bubble of acid from the pit at a point you can see within 30 feet of the pit. The bubble explodes when it reaches the point, which can be in the air, and each creature within a 20-foot radius sphere of the bubble when it explodes must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.
A creature that is not immune to acid damage must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot moved within the acid.

components.m: a shard of a broken cauldron or vial

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage from being in the acid increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 7th, and the damage from the bubbles increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Talon's Black Flames

components.m: a shard of obsidian and a drop of pitch

entries: You unleash a sweeping wave of black flames in a 30-foot cone. All creatures within the cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage and {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Any creature who fails their saving throw is cursed for 1 minute, suffering disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks as the lingering black flames weaken their resolve and strength. A creature cursed by this spell can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success. A {@spell remove curse} or {@spell dispel magic} spell also ends the curse.

The flames cling to surfaces and remain as dark, flickering embers for the next minute, darkening bright light to dim light and dim light to darkness and imposing disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks relying on sight. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the fire or the necrotic damage (your choice) increases by {@scaledamage 4d6|5-9|1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Talon's Crackling Doom
entries: You release an explosive burst of lightning energy from your body, sending crackling arcs of electricity through the air. Each creature within 30 feet of you is {@condition blinded|srd} until the end of its next turn and must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d12} lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

The sheer force of the spell scorches the ground in the area, leaving deep cracks and scorched earth. Any non-magical objects within range that aren't being worn or carried are instantly destroyed, reduced to ash by the explosive lightning.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d12|5-9|1d12} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Talon's Internal Melting
entries: You magically take hold of a creature's internal components, mechanisms, or organs to crush them into a corrosive paste. The creature takes {@damage 6d12} acid damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 6d12} additional acid damage and suffers the following effects:

items: It can move no more than 10 feet per turn.
It has disadvantage on all Strength and Dexterity ability checks and saving throws.

entries: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d12} acid damage on a failed save, and the spell ends on a successful one.

spell.name: Talon's Lightning Lash
entries: You weave strands of electricity together into a crackling whip to strike at your enemies. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d12} lightning damage and has disadvantage on the next Strength or Dexterity saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d12|2-9|1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Talon's Pestilent Grasp
entries: You create a Large, ghostly hand within range. This hand is incorporeal and does not occupy its space, does not obscure vision or provide cover, and does not impede movement. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the hand. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d4} necrotic and {@damage 2d4} poison damage, and it is {@condition grappled|srd} by the hand until the start of your next turn. The creature can use an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (its choice) against your spell save DC. If the creature succeeds, it breaks free of the hand's grasp and is no longer {@condition grappled|srd}.
Until the spell ends, as an action on your turn, you can move the hand up to 30 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the necrotic and poison damage both increase by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Talon's Rain of Bones
entries: You conjure a cloud of negative energy that rains massive bones down in a 60-foot radius, 100-foot high cylinder centered on a point on the ground within range. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 5d10} bludgeoning and {@damage 5d10} necrotic damage on a failed save as it gets pummeled by the bones. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage.

The bones turn the ground into {@quickref difficult terrain||3} until they crumble to dust at the end of your next turn. Any spell cast using these conjured bones as a material component automatically fails.

spell.name: Talon's Water Jet
entries: You conjure a high pressure stream of water and blast it at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d8} bludgeoning damage.

On a hit or a miss, the water splashes anything within a 10-foot-radius sphere of the target. The water douses nonmagical flames and any magical flames created by a spell cast with a slot level lower than the one used to cast this spell.
The amount of water conjured is a number of gallons equal to ten times the level of the spell slot used to cast the spell. The water disappears at the end of your turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d8|4-9|1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Thrashing Vines
entries: You call upon nature's wrath to crush your foes. Roots and vines grow and surge forward to crush all creatures within 10 feet of you. Each creature in that area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage and has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and suffers no other effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|1-9|1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thread of Glamour
entries: You weave an aura of subtle glamour into a willing target's presence. For the duration, it gains advantage on Charisma checks, and creatures within 30 feet of it have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made against it.
Additionally, any mundane dirt, tears, or damage to its belongings or appearance seems to vanish.

spell.name: Thornbrush Mantle
entries: Thorny vines and bark twist around your limbs, hardening your skin and shaping your body. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +2 bonus to AC.
You cannot be {@condition grappled|srd} or {@condition restrained|srd} by non-magical means.
Any creature that hits you with a melee attack takes {@damage 2d4} piercing damage.

As a bonus action, you can launch a volley of thorns. Creatures in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d4} piercing damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

spell.name: Warden's Watch
entries: You heighten your senses to an extraordinary degree, becoming acutely aware of your surroundings. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks, and you gain a +5 bonus to your Passive Perception as a result of this advantage.
You cannot be {@condition surprised|srd}, and you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|srd} or {@condition frightened|srd}.

You can see {@condition invisible|srd} creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you automatically detect the location of hidden or concealed creatures or objects within range. You also automatically know if a creature or object within range is disguised or transformed through any magical or mundane means, but you gain no additional ability to discern its true form.

components.m: a focus such as a crystal ball, a silver mirror, or a font filled with holy water

spell.name: Whisperthread
entries: You weave a psychic thread between yourself and one willing creature you can see within range. For the duration, you and the target can communicate telepathically, and you can project your voice into its mind to accurately mimic any tone, noise, or voice you have heard. The communication is possible over any distance, though it can't extend to other planes of existence.

spell.name: Wyrmroot Prison
entries: You summon ancient roots from the earth, serpentine, thorny, and thrumming with malice. One Large or smaller creature of your choice must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained|srd} as the roots form a prison of living wood around it. The roots have an AC of 18, 50 HP, are immune to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage, and are vulnerable to fire damage.
At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage. On a success, it takes half damage and breaks free of the roots.
Whenever the target takes damage, you can pick one creature within 90 feet of the prison to regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

components.m: a thorn plucked from a blighted plant

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d8|1-9|1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

fly.condition: (hover, only while concentrating on a spell)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Adrien can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} with spell attacks):

action.name: {@spell Shocking Grasp}
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) lightning damage.

reaction.name: Sorcerous Shield (2/Day).
entries: When he is hit by an attack, Adrien protects himself with an {@condition invisible|SRD} barrier of magical force. Until the end of his next turn, he gains a +3 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

reaction.name: Crackling Counterspell (1/Day).
entries: When Adrien sees a creature within 60 feet of him casting a spell, he tries to interrupt it. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, it fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th level or higher, Adrien makes a Charisma check ({@dc 10} plus the spell's level). On a successful check, the spell fails and has no effect. Whatever the spell's level, the caster takes 12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3})  lightning damage if the spell fails.

monster.name: Grakthor

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Grakthor is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 18} to hit with spell attacks). Grakthor can cast {@spell detect magic} and {@spell detect thoughts} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Staff Spellcasting
headerEntries: While holding his {@item staff of power}, Grakthor can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 18} to hit with spell attacks). These spells require charges; the staff has 20 charges, and it regains {@dice 2d8 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.
1 charge each: {@spell magic missile}, {@spell ray of enfeeblement}

5 charges each: {@spell cone of cold} ({@damage 8d8} cold damage), {@spell fireball} ({@damage 10d6} fire damage), {@spell hold monster}, {@spell lightning bolt} ({@damage 10d6} lightning damage), {@spell wall of force}

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Grakthor wears a grey {@item robe of the archmagi} and a {@item ring of mind shielding}, and wields a {@item staff of power} (all accounted for in his statistics). He also wears an amber necklace enchanted to function as one half of a pair of {@item sending stones}; the other half of the pair is a matching amber necklace worn by {@creature Gundroc Khon|Talons}. If a creature other than Grakthor or Gundroc attempts to use either necklace, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 24} Intelligence saving throw, taking 90 ({@damage 20d8}) psychic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Grakthor hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Grakthor has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|srd} and {@condition frightened|srd}.

trait.name: Foresight
entries: Grakthor adds his Intelligence score to his AC and initiative rolls (included in the stat block).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Grakthor fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: While wearing his {@item robe of the archmagi}, Grakthor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Padded Feet
entries: Grakthor has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to move silently.

trait.name: {@item Ring of Mind Shielding}
entries: Grakthor wears an {@condition invisible} {@item ring of mind shielding}. He is immune to magic that allows other creatures to read his thoughts, determine whether he is lying, know his alignment, or know his creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with him only if he allows it.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If Grakthor surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Grakthor makes three Arcane Burst attacks and uses Spellcasting or Staff Spellcasting.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) psychic damage.

action.name: Staff of Power
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Overwhelming Revelation {@recharge 5}
entries: Grakthor magically creates a burst of illumination in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of him. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned|srd} until the end of Grakthor's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned|srd}.

reaction.name: Portent (7/Day)
entries: When Grakthor or a creature he can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, he rolls a {@dice d20} and chooses whether to use that roll in place of the {@dice d20} rolled for the attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

legendaryHeader: Grakthor can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Grakthor regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Grakthor teleports 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 actions)
entries: Grakthor casts a spell using a spell slot.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Gundroc wears an amber necklace enchanted to function as one half of a pair of {@item sending stones}; the other half of the pair is a matching amber necklace worn by {@creature Grakthor|Talons}. If a creature other than Grakthor or Gundroc attempts to use either necklace, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 24} Intelligence saving throw, taking 90 ({@damage 20d8}) psychic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Adamantine Armory
entries: Gundroc's weapon attacks are magical, and they score a critical hit on a 19 or 20. In addition, any critical hit against Gundroc becomes a normal hit.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals two extra dice of its damage when Gundroc hits with it.

trait.name: Bugbear's Inspiration
entries: Gundroc and allied creatures within 30 feet of him who can see or hear him have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws and gain a +1 bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls. Allied creatures within this range also share his Limited Magic Immunity feature.

trait.name: Coordinated Assault
entries: When Gundroc hits a creature with an attack, allied creatures who can see Gundroc have advantage on their attack rolls made against the target before the start of Gundroc's next turn.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Gundroc fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Gundroc can't be affected or detected by spells of 3rd level or lower unless he wishes to be. He has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Padded Feet
entries: Gundroc has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to move silently.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If Gundroc surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gundroc makes three weapon attacks in any combination.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw}  {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw}  {@hit 15} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: Melee  or Ranged Weapon Attack:  {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bark Orders {@recharge 4}
entries: Each ally within 60 feet of Gundroc who can hear and understand him can use a reaction to move up to its speed and take the Attack action.

reaction.name: Bolstering Pride
entries: When another creature within 60 feet of Gundroc who can hear and understand him makes a saving throw, Gundroc can give that creature advantage on the saving throw.

monster.name: Jarvis

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Jarvis is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 18} to hit with spell attacks). Jarvis can cast {@spell disguise self} and {@spell invisibility} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Staff Spellcasting
headerEntries: While holding his {@item staff of power}, Jarvis can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 18} to hit with spell attacks). These spells require charges; the staff has 20 charges, and it regains {@dice 2d8 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.
1 charge each: {@spell magic missile}, {@spell ray of enfeeblement}

5 charges each: {@spell cone of cold} ({@damage 8d8} cold damage), {@spell fireball} ({@damage 10d6} fire damage), {@spell hold monster}, {@spell lightning bolt} ({@damage 10d6} lightning damage), {@spell wall of force}

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Jarvis wears a grey {@item robe of the archmagi} and a {@item ring of mind shielding}, and wields a {@item staff of power} (all accounted for in his statistics).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Grakthor fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: While wearing his {@item robe of the archmagi}, Jarvis has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: {@item Ring of Mind Shielding}
entries: Jarvis wears an {@condition invisible} {@item ring of mind shielding}. He is immune to magic that allows other creatures to read his thoughts, determine whether he is lying, know his alignment, or know his creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with him only if he allows it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Jarvis makes three Arcane Burst attacks and uses Spellcasting or Staff Spellcasting.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) psychic damage.

action.name: Staff of Power
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

legendaryHeader: Jarvis can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Jarvis regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Jarvis teleports 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 actions)
entries: Jarvis casts a spell using a spell slot.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ssesthraxa is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared, which don't require material components:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Ssesthraxa can use her action to polymorph into a Huge giant constrictor snake, or back into her Medium medusa form. Her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying is transformed. Ssesthraxa reverts to her medusa form if she dies.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Ssesthraxa fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Ssesthraxa has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see Ssesthraxa's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of her, she can force it to make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw if she isn't {@condition incapacitated|srd} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly {@condition petrified|srd}. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained|srd}. The {@condition restrained|srd} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition petrified|srd} on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the *greater restoration* spell or other magic.

Unless {@status surprised}, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see Ssesthraxa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at Ssesthraxa in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Venomous Weapons
entries: Ssesthraxa's weapon attacks are magical. When Ssesthraxa hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ssesthraxa makes three attacks in any combination. She can replace two attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Snake Hair (Medusa Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw}  {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw}  {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 7d6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled|srd} (escape {@dc 21}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained|srd}, and Ssesthraxa can't constrict another target.

action.name: Scimitar (Medusa Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw}  {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Holy Fire (Medusa Form Only)
entries: {@atk rs}  {@hit 14} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 7}) radiant damage.

action.name: Poison Ray
entries: {@atk rs}  {@hit 14} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) poison damage.

bonus.name: Shed Skin (1/Day)
entries: Ssesthraxa can shed her skin as a bonus action to free herself from a grapple, shackles, or other restraints. If Ssesthraxa spends 1 minute eating her shed skin, she regains hit points equal to half her hit point maximum.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Ssesthraxa moves up to her speed.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Ssesthraxa makes two attacks.

legendary.name: Constrict (Costs 2 actions)
entries: Ssesthraxa uses Constrict.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 actions)
entries: Ssesthraxa casts a spell using a spell slot.

ac.special: 12 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The serpent can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The serpent has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.

trait.name: Venom Glands (Venomous Only)
entries: The serpent's bite attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6 + summonSpellLevel} poison damage. Once per turn, when it hits with a bite attack, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. It can repeat the Constitution saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The serpent makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 2 + summonSpellLevel} piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict (Constrictor Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 2 + summonSpellLevel} bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled|srd} ({@dcYourSpellSave} to escape). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained|srd}, and the snake can't constrict another target.

bonus.name: Neck Hood {@recharge 5}
entries: The serpent lifts its upper body up, flaring out its neck like a hood and hissing menacingly. Each creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of the serpent and can hear it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw {@dcYourSpellSave} or become {@condition frightened} of the serpent for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Swallow (Constrictor Only)
entries: The serpent makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has {@quickref Cover||3||total cover} against attacks and other effects outside the serpent, and it takes {@damage 1d12 + summonSpellLevel} acid damage at the start of each of the serpent's turns. The serpent can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

If the serpent takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the serpent must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the serpent. If the serpent dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and falls {@condition prone} as the serpent disappears.
